title: RIOT is being WAY too sensitive with the bans.
body:
Nowadays, I sometimes receive 2-week bans or chat restrictions for just plain arguments with teammates. It does not even need to be toxic speech during the game, it seems like just 2 people arguing about something is ban worthy. Arguing is natural and is very likely to happen in teams of 5 people who all have important roles. 

Furthermore, even as a kid playing good ol' Runescape, it was very rare to receive a ban or chat restriction for something as little as arguing. Now why is the league of legends community so much more sensitive than even the old Runescape community which consisted of much younger players. 

How it is right now is very unhealthy for the game. Basically, if you are not a positive nancy, EVERY SINGLE GAME you will be banned. Well guess what, sometimes when there is a kid picking unorthodox champs for his lane and intentionally feeding, you are not happy with having to waste time waiting for the game to end. Afterwards, its not the kid that is trolling who gets punished, ITS THE PLAYER WHO GOT IRRITATED THAT HE IS WASTING TIME!

At this rate, people who have spent years trying to climb to high ranks can be banned from just one bad game that consists of a troll that you must release your displeasure to. I love this game but I am so close to quitting only because of how easily everything you worked for gets thrown away, just because you had a normal argument with a teammate? 

I am sure it is not just me who believes that when you compare the league community to other online games, this is the most pussy community by far.

I would disagree with your characterization regarding the community of league of legends and I also disagree with your characterization on how to not be permabanned. 

First I'll address the permaban characterization. You don't have to be a "positive nancy" (btw, I think this is fairly indicative of your toxic chat behavior) every single game to not be permabanned. The standard is "don't be dishonorable." This has been repeated by several red posts. 

Second, regarding the league community characterization and comparisons....

Runescape is awful. I have no idea how you tolerate the people in Runescape but they are so juvenile and immature that it's not fun to play with others. It's almost like playing exclusively with screaming children throwing temper tantrums who have the vocabulary and technical knowledge of teenagers. Kudos to you if you have the patience to deal with that but I don't. I'd rather have people just not talk and focus on the game rather than try to blame everyone and everything else for their mess up and then turn into a giant flame fest which ends up being ultra disruptive because they would have done better had they not spent so much time in the fountain typing at teammates.

What you can do for your example about intentional feeding teammates is report them and move on. What isn't health is you holding on to your bitter rage and then trying to be toxic by expressing your "irritation" in an antisocial way. You can address inters and trolls in a pro social way without flaming them and without insulting them and still let them know their behavior is unacceptable and move on. This is actually good for the community because it weeds out the toxic players that make playing the game not fun. They'll either learn that their behavior is anti social and will stop it or they will be permabanned from the community. If there is 1 troll in a game, it's better to ban that 1 troll and keep 9 players rather than keep 1 troll and lose 9 good players due to the toxic environment... like what's happened in Runescape...

You are definitely not the only one who considers the league of legends community to be "pussy" (also way to prove how toxic you aren't by being sexist) but you'll notice that those that agree with you are the ones who have been punished in the past and or permabanned, which is a minority of players... which means your behavior is not the norm.

You'll also see that many other large companies are starting to address toxicity in their games. Just google it. You won't have to look very far to find large name companies addressing toxic behavior on their games because it's hurting their bottom line.
